page.title: 04CARING FOR NEWHAVEN PEOPLE
page.content: There are six Doctors plus a trainee, who hold surgeries in the Health Centre. There are also five district Nurses, four Health visitors, two auxiliary nurses, and one Dietician. The centre also runs Ante Natal, baby and toddlers, speech therapy, Audiology and eye clinics, Chiropody for aged and children, plus cytology and Family Planning Clinics. There are two Dentists in Newhaven and a dental service for children. Three ambulances serve Newhaven. Emergency cases are rushed to Eastbourne Hospital. The Downs Hospital, originally the Workhouse, caters for geriatrics and physiotherapy. The County Council run a day centre for pensioners and a workshop for mentally handicapped people.
